result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Robert Wedemayer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Absolutely no contact with victim. 
Counseling.
AODA & follow through.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Robert Wedemayer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Robert Wedemayer in court, in custody with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF142 & 14CF216 @ 11:35 am.  Plea advisement filed.  State gives plea agreement on 14CF142 state moves to amend 4th degree sexual assault. 940.225(3m), class a misdemeanor, plea to ct's 1 & 2. ct 1 withheld sentence 2 yrs probation, no contact with victim,  counseling & AODA & costs ct 2 withheld sentence 1 yr probation, concurrent, & concurrent to 14CF216 counseling & costs. 14CF216 ct's 1 & 3 ct 1 withheld sentence 3 yrs probation, AODA, 3214 fine totaling, 3 yrs revocation, 1 year IID, 1 year jail, free to argue, ct 3 withheld sentence 2 year probation, AODA & costs.  Parties agree to plea agreement. Court will amend ct 1 in 14CF142 4th degree sexual assault, no contest plea, ct 2 D.C. no contest plea. 14CF216 Def. admits 4 prior convictions.  This is an 5th offense of OWI. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause. Information filed.  Atty Nocco has copy of information & waives reading. Ct 1 OWI 5th, no contest plea, ct. 3 Poss of THC, 2nd offense, Def. admits prior conviction of THC. ct 3 no contest plea. ct's 2, 4 & 5 Dismissed. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. BAC. .220, Atty Nocco factual basis & is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to 14CF142 4th degree Sexual Assault, ct 1 & DC in ct 2 & in 14CF216 OWI 5th in ct 1 & Poss of THC 2nd in ct 3. State gives statement. S.H. gives statement. State gives sentencing argument. Atty Nocco gives sentencing argument on jail time. 14CF216 30 days credit time served. 14CF142 8 days credit, time served. State replys. Def. has nothing to say. State objects to furlough. 
Court orders on
14CF142 ct 1 withheld sentence 2 yrs probation, Absolutely no contact with victim, counseling, AODA & follow through & costs & 200 DNA surcharge
ct 2 withheld sentence 1 year probation, concurrent to ct 1, counseling & costs. 8 days credit if revoked. 200 DNA surcharge.  Bond to be applied to child support obligations to CSA. 
14CF216 ct 1 withheld sentence 3 years probation, concurrent to 14CF142  AODA & follow through, Fine including costs totaling 3214, 36 months revocation, retroactive to Adim. Susp.  1 year IID, upon application, 1 year jail, huber privileges, Court denies furlough. c. immediately. DNA Sample & 250 surcharge. Def. advised of voting & firearm rights. 30 days credit if revoked. 250 is included already in fine. 
ct 3 withheld sentence 2 years probation, concurrent to ct 1 & 14CF142, AODA  & 250 DNA surcharge & costs. 
 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Atty Nocco has copy of information, waives reading, & enters Not Guilty plea to each ct's. Court enters Not Guilty plea on both ct's. Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
